instructions:
Break up and brown ground beef in drippings in a 6 quart pot. Add chopped onions and green pepper and
sauté for about 3 minutes. Add spaghetti sauce and sugar. Cover and simmer for 1 hour. Then stir in
Parmesan cheese, add mushrooms and cooked meat balls and sauce from recipe below and continue
simmering for 1/2 hour.

MEAT BALLS
1 lb ground beef
1 egg
1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese
1/3 cup Italian seasoned bread crumbs
1/2 tsp onion salt
1/2 tsp garlic salt

While sauce is simmering, beat egg and combine above ingredients. Form into 12 two inch meat balls *(or
24 one and one half inch meat balls)*. In a large hot non-stick skillet that has a lid, add 2 tbsp vegetable oil
and brown the meat balls on all sides. Drain all but 1 tbsp grease from skillet and pour 1 1/2 cups of
spaghetti sauce over the meat balls, cover and simmer over low heat for ½ hour. Turn meatballs occasionally
so they don't stick. 
*(Rev. 3/30/95)*.
ingredients: 74 oz canned spaghetti sauce (48 oz Del Grosso,
26 oz Chunky Ragu, Aunt Millie's, etc)
name: Spaghetti Sauce And Meatballs
